website_summaries.verdict: Choose this hammer if you need a reliably durable option, but don't be surprised if it's heavier than you expect.
pros: Stands out for its rugged handle made of solid hickory wood
Head and pein have a ground and polished finish that resists rust and corrosion
cons: A few customers report that it's heavier than 12 oz
– more like 16, which won't work for all uses

customer_reviews.title: Great weight hammer
customer_reviews.text: Great weight hammer, build quality is excellent and balance as well. The only thing that was a bit frustrating is when removing the stickers on the wood handle, the residue was difficult to remove. I left the hammer in the sun to heat up and used a towel to remove it...took a bit but now it's clean. It would be nice if they used stickers that you could remove easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Best

customer_reviews.title: Like others, got a 16oz head labeled 12oz.  What the heck?
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent quality hammer, but the weight is a lie. I carefully weighted it on a scale while supporting the handle gently, and it's definitely a 16 ounce hammer head. I need the hammer and don't care enough to deal with returning it, but it seems like Amazon has a run of mislabeled stock.
customer_reviews.author: Nom, nom, nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Vaughan makes good hammers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, great price. The sticker residue on the handle has to be removed after peeling off the sticker. This size is great for a lot of work that requires finesse.
customer_reviews.author: Someoneyoumayknow

customer_reviews.title: Stayed strong while I pounded it hard
customer_reviews.text: Solid product likely to never have any issues with the head coming off the tip
customer_reviews.author: Chobble Gobler

customer_reviews.title: USA and nice!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet hammer. Made in the US and you can tell. The head is nice steel and I thought the wrap was ill conceived at first, so I started taking it off; but as I worked it, I found it really lowers the friction in your hand. It's a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: C. Morr

customer_reviews.title: Hammer, company sticker
customer_reviews.text: It's a hammer but, the Vaughan company sticker was placed strategically on the handle over a gouge in the wood. I hope it doesn't break when used.
customer_reviews.author: dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Good hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good hammer made in the USA. I'll probably buy more.
customer_reviews.author: M. Galvin

customer_reviews.title: Best nang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality hammer, I left the plastic coating/cover on the handle to keep the wood from getting oil soaked. Well balanced, well built great overall quality. I bought it to drive 1/4, 5/16, 3/8 and 7/16 press fit steel dowels into dies at work. It’s the perfect weight for such job.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L Ortmann

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what it's supposed to be...a 12 oz. ball peen hammer. I wanted something for light gunsmithing, especially driving roll pins. This is just the right weight...it's nice and controllable.
customer_reviews.author: Ceemack

customer_reviews.title: Classic Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Classic ball pein hammer, made in the USA. Amazon offers these in various weights; the 12-once hammer is a good choice. Easy to use, but not clumsy, as heavier weights can be. Vaughan hammers work and feel like classic tools, and look the part. Comfortable in hand.
customer_reviews.author: James G, Fraser

customer_reviews.title: It is built really well and looks nice, but they dropped the ball on this one
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 12 oz because I wanted a 12 oz, this one is clearly marked 12 oz but is actually 16 oz. It is built really well and looks nice, but they dropped the ball on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Old Deadeye

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer, as nice as my 30 year old Blue Point
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hammer 🔨 , WRONG WEIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: Nice Hammer. WRONG WEIGHT. Ordered 12 oz , Received 16 oz . As Photo Shows. Going to keep it but not what I Ordered , to heavy for the job I Purchased For. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Biggs

customer_reviews.title: While this is a quality hammer I like another reviewer also received a 16 oz
customer_reviews.text: While this is a quality hammer I like another reviewer also received a 16 oz. hammer that was marked 12 oz. I will give it away as a gift and look elsewhere for a 12 oz. hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: Great to hit stuff with
customer_reviews.text: It beats the heck out of anything I use it for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Hammer
customer_reviews.text: I use it for light work on my little anvil. Quality seems right on!
customer_reviews.author: Frank L. Bales

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money, and more important it's made in America.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: A good forged US-made hammer.  Could have better finish.
customer_reviews.text: A well-balanced ball-pein hammer. I'm knocking off one star because the ball-end could be better finished: it took about 30 minutes with some emory cloth to get it where I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: ASG

customer_reviews.title: It hammers well.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for hammering jewelry making and it's solid. Even passed the husband test for quality. It hammers well.
customer_reviews.author: BeNice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Well made using quality materials. "Made in USA" makes a difference if you're going to actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: KY Mel

customer_reviews.title: Nice hammer, well made, not 12 oz.
customer_reviews.text: I like this hammer, it is well made and will last a long time. it is not a 12 ounce hammer (despite what it's labelled.) It is more like 16 - 20 ounces. I'll keep searching for a well made 12 ounce hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R Mora

product_meta.title: Vaughan TC2012 12-Ounce Commercial Ball Pein Hammer
product_meta.description: Ball Pein Hammer, Handle Type Hickory, Head Weight 12 Ounces, Face Smooth, Head Dia 1 7/8 In

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars73 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
